stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements concerning the relationship between the three empires shown on the map is most accurate?

features.html:
• The map shows the northern half of the continent of Africa and the following bodies of water:

    • the Atlantic Ocean to the west

    • the Mediterranean Sea to the north

    • the Red Sea to the east

    • the Gulf of Guinea to the south

  • The following features are also shown:

    • Ghana Empire

    • Mali Empire

    • Songhai Empire

    • Trade routes

    • Mansa Musa’s pilgrimage route

  • The Ghana Empire is located in central West Africa.

  • The Mali Empire encompasses the Ghana Empire and extends farther east, south, and west.

  • The Songhai Empire encompasses the Ghana and Mali Empires and extends farther north and east.

  • Several trade routes originate in the empires:

    • Some routes head north toward the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea.

      • One of these heads eastward along the coast of the Mediterranean Sea.

    • Additional routes link within the empires.

    • One route heads south toward the Gulf of Guinea.

    • One route heads northeast toward the Red Sea.

  • Mansa Musa’s pilgrimage route:

    • Originates near the center of the empires

    • Moves to the northern edge of the Songhai Empire

    • Joins the northeast trade route toward the Red Sea

    • Passes north of the Red Sea and then turns south to Mecca

choicesHtml: They are the same empire with three names to represent the stages of development.
They each reached their height at different times and expanded from the decline of the previous empire.
All three formed a formidable triple alliance that allowed them to control the region from about 600 to 1600 CE.
The presence of the three political entities in one area of Africa destabilized the region, allowing for conquest by European enslavers.
